primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God is actively working behind the scenes of human suffering and historical darkness to bring about justice and redemption.

tekstueel_bewijs: God makes his universe to turn on axles of justice
the Father who worked hitherto works still

object.identificatie: Justice and the 'saving of the nation' through the 'approaching dawn'.

tekstueel_bewijs: those across this land who have made their commitment
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer identifies as the Receiver of God's hidden work while being the Subject of the secondary commitment.

helper.identificatie: Scripture and the 'tragic testimony' of historical actors.
helper.rol_van_god: God is the primary Subject, not just a Helper.
helper.rol_van_geest: Implicit as the 'plastic' power working in Simon.

tegenstander.identificatie: The 'tortured night' of uncertainty, horror, and human betrayal.
tekstueel_bewijs: dark and fearful night of waiting
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is described as a 'tortured night' and 'insuperable burden', suggesting a weight beyond mere human psychology.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: Believers committing to sacrifice and hazard for the nation.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Christians/Hearers
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The human commitment (Secondary) is sustained by the confidence that God is working (Primary).

voorbeelden_god_subject: God makes his universe to turn
voorbeelden_mens_subject: Those... who have made their commitment

voorbeelden: commitment to the Christian way of sacrifice
searching the skies for some sign
power of God to work in human situations
plastic to the workings of God's grace

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on God's 'ability' (Pouvoir) to act when humans are 'unable' (the night is unbearable).

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From S2 (Night) to ~S1 (Silence) to S1 (Justice) via ~S2 (Grace/Plasticity).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: God's hidden activity (S1) is the reality even when only S2 is visible.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High; the night is described as 'unbearable' and 'tortured'.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: Despite the title 'Redemption is Costly' (which often signals moralism), the text identifies God as the primary actor even in the failures of Judas and Peter.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: Those... who have made their commitment

indicatoren_genade.indicator: God as Subject of hidden work
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: the Father who worked hitherto works still
Simon... was likewise plastic to the workings of God's grace

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Judas and Peter are not models to follow, but 'testimony' to God's power.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sermon already uses a theocentric reading: Peter's tears are God's work, not Peter's virtue.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Comfort and 'confidence' in the midst of suffering.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Soteriology is grounded in God's ontological governance (axles of justice).

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the 'night' of the hearers to the 'night' of Calvary is seamless.
spanning_punten: The tension between human 'commitment' and being 'plastic' to grace.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: God making the universe turn on axles of justice despite the night.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: Endowment; making the subject 'plastic' to change.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Severe; leading to 'bitter tears' and 'flinging life away'.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully positions God as the Subject of the primary narrative, with humans as the 'plastic' recipients of His work.

identificatie_herstel.problematische_identificatie: The opening identifies hearers by their 'commitment' (Subject role).
identificatie_herstel.voorgestelde_identificatie: Identify hearers first by their 'waiting' (Receiver role).
identificatie_herstel.strategie: Move the description of God's work to the very first sentence.

modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Link God's 'Pouvoir' more explicitly to the 'cost' mentioned in the title.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Soteriology (God's work in Calvary) clearly grounds the Ethics (the commitment).

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A profound example of theocentric preaching that finds God's agency even in the darkest human failures.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorical analysis would focus on the 'night/dawn' metaphor; Greimas shows that God is the functional engine of the dawn.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis would explain the centurion's quote; Greimas shows the centurion is a 'Helper' to the narrative of God's power.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals the 'plasticity' of Simon as a modal competence (Pouvoir) granted by the Subject (God).

appendices.notities: The sermon avoids the 'Be like Peter' trap by making Peter the object of God's grace.
